author: Da AE
title: Gretchen se irrita com colegas no Power Couple Brasil por disputa de comida: Questão de respeito
text:
Nesta quarta-feira dia, 30, Gretchen protagonizou um momento de tensão no Power Couple Brasil ao expressar sua insatisfação com alguns colegas de confinamento. A cantora criticou participantes que, segundo ela, pegam comida em excesso sem considerar os demais, especialmente os mais velhos.
Em conversa com outros confinados, Gretchen mencionou que seu marido, Esdras de Souza, tem enfrentado dificuldades para se alimentar adequadamente devido ao comportamento de alguns participantes.
- Qual é a minha obrigação? Cuidar de nós, mas eu já cuido da parte da comida dele [do Esdras]. É uma questão de respeito. Quando ele vem [comer] já não tem mais porque todo mundo pegou e não quer saber dele. Eu sempre cuido da carne que ele come, ele não come carne vermelha, sempre cuido se o frango está descongelado, observou.
A cantora também criticou a atitude de alguns participantes durante o preparo do café da manhã:
- De manhã, sempre os grandões são os primeiros [a se servir], os primeiros que chegam no fogão. Ninguém consegue nem chegar perto do fogão, por quê? Por que eles querem fazer o café do jeito que eles querem, eles usam quatro panelas. A gente tem que ficar esperando eles fazerem o café.
O clima esquentou ainda mais quando Gretchen se desentendeu com Diego Superbi, que pegou uma carne separada para Esdras. A cantora chamou o colega de sem educação. Diego reconheceu o erro e pediu desculpas, mas Gretchen manteve sua posição. Na área externa, ao lado de outros colegas, afirmou que Diego não durará muito tempo no reality.
- Ele pode até voltar [da D.R] a primeira vez, mas na segunda ele não escapa, porque aí já vão ter visto as coisas que ele fez, declarou a artista.
Eita!
Atenção! Os comentários do site são via Facebook. Lembre-se de que o comentário é de inteira responsabilidade do autor e não expressa a opinião do jornal. Comentários que violem a lei, a moral e os bons costumes ou violem direitos de terceiros poderão ser denunciados pelos usuários e sua conta poderá ser banida.

author: Nick Stoico
title: Biden at Harvard: Former president visits students
text:
Former president Joe Biden visited the Harvard Kennedy School on Wednesday to meet with students at the invitation of his longtime adviser, Mike Donilon, according to the school.
Biden met with students in a seminar course led by Donilon, who is a fellow at the Kennedy School’s Institute of Politics for the spring, according to a person familiar with the event. They said about 50 students attended the event and had an off-the-record Q&A style discussion with Biden.
In a statement, the Kennedy School said Biden joins a list of former presidents and presidential candidates from both major political parties who have visited the school, including presidents George H.W. Bush, Bill Clinton, Bob Dole, Jeb Bush, John McCain, and Al Gore.
“As a school devoted to training the next generation of public leaders, we are proud to welcome senior policy makers and political figures representing a broad cross-section of views to engage with our students,” a Kennedy School spokesperson said in a statement.
Biden’s visit was first reported by the Harvard Crimson .
Advertisement
Sources familiar with the visit said Donilon invited Biden to speak with students several weeks ago. They said the former president’s visit to Cambridge on Wednesday was not related to the university’s ongoing dispute with the Trump administration, which has threatened the university’s tax-exempt status and froze $2 billion in federal funding over its handling of antisemitism on campus.
The Crimson reported that select students in the Kennedy School received invitations Tuesday to attend the visit but were not told who the guest would be.
Advertisement

author: @cairo24_
title: نشر بياناته كاملة.. شاومينج يورط طالبا ويسرب اسمه في صورة متداولة لامتحان الفيزياء
text:
نشر بياناته كاملة.. شاومينج يورط طالبا ويسرب اسمه في صورة متداولة لامتحان الفيزياء
ورط شاومينج، طالبا بالثانوية العامة لنشرة بياناته كاملة، حيث تداول جروب تليجرام شاومينج صورة متداولة من امتحان الفيزياء يظهر فيها اسم الطالب بالكامل واسم المدرسة.
وضوح بيانات الطالب بامتحان الفيزياء لطلاب الثانوية العامة 2025
وأثارت الواقعة جدلًا واسعًا بين أولياء الأمور والطلاب، خاصة مع وضوح بيانات الطالب على ورقة الإجابة، حيث يُدعى الطالب ي. ن بمدرسة الشهيد أحمد فؤاد بمدينة كفر شكر محافظة القليوبية، الأمر الذي دفع البعض للمطالبة بالتحقيق في الواقعة واتخاذ الإجراءات اللازمة.
يأتي ذلك بالتزامن مع استمرار امتحانات الثانوية العامة، وسط تشديدات على منع تسريب وتداول الامتحانات أو تصويرها داخل اللجان.
لم تصدر وزارة التعليم أي تعليق بشأن الصورة المتداولة
ولم تصدر وزارة التربية والتعليم والتعليم الفني حتى الآن أي تعليق رسمي بشأن الواقعة.
وتداولت جروبات الغش الإلكتروني، على تطبيق تليجرام، صورًا زُعم أنها لأسئلة امتحان الفيزياء لطلاب الثانوية العامة 2025، والذي يؤديه الطلاب الآن داخل اللجان، وذلك وسط تفاعل واسع بين الطلاب، في محاولة للحصول على إجابات خلال وقت اللجنة.
من جانبها، أكدت وزارة التربية والتعليم والتعليم الفني أنها رصدت الواقعة فور حدوثها، وتقوم حاليًا بتتبع مصدر الصور المتداولة وتحديد هوية الطالب أو اللجنة التي خرجت منها، بالتنسيق مع الجهات الأمنية المعنية.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: West Michigan mom shares how to give back during winter weather
text: More than 200 West Michigan schools were closed Friday because of the expected snow. Most districts are closed Monday as well to observe Martin Luther King Jr. Day. If you're a parent at home looking for something to do during the long weekend ahead — a West Michigan mom has an idea on how to stay busy while also giving back. Kim Peters made this post to her local Facebook group: Peters is the Community Outreach co-lead for local tech company Vervint, and she hopes her idea will catch on. “As a mom, my daughter is a senior this year, but I remember many a snow day where you could only, especially as a single parent, where you only had so many activities you could go through,” Peters explained. Her idea is making bracelets for the Children's Advocacy Center of Kent County. “We provide services for survivors of suspected child sexual abuse,” Children's Advocacy Center Development and Communications Director Kate Lange said. The idea hit Peters when she was making the bracelets at work, as part of an activity to celebrate the opening of Vervint's new building, and most importantly, give back to the community. It's small — making a bracelet — but these bracelets hold great meaning, and are headed to children who really need them at the Children's Advocacy Center. “The role of these bracelets is they’re provided to our clients as they navigate these services, as positive reminders but also as a coping tool as they process their trauma,” Lange explained. The bracelets, with positive messages on them, mean a lot to the CAC. The CAC says this weekend is also a good time to have a conversation with your child about body safety. For Peters, it's a simple way to give back for those who need it most. “We do have a faith base in our family. So for us, we recognize very much that though these bracelets are beautiful and there’s a lot of people out there that are wearing these bracelets as friendship bracelets to concerts, and whatnot, a lot of times for these little children, they’re wearing these bracelets because something traumatic happened in their life,” she said. For more ideas on how to volunteer with the CAC, click here list of activities on its website. Follow FOX 17: Facebook - Twitter - Instagram - YouTube

organizations.name: children's advocacy center development and communications

author: SAPO
title: Trabalhadores da Boeing em Seattle aprovam greve - Atualidade - SAPO 24
text: Os trabalhadores votaram 96% a favor da greve, disse o presidente do sindicato dos maquinistas IAM-Distrito 751, Jon Holden. “Vamos entrar em greve à meia-noite” locais (08:00 em Lisboa), acrescentou. A paralisação vai abranger cerca de 33 mil trabalhadores da montagem de aviões, a maioria dos quais na zona de Seattle, levando à suspensão da produção dos aviões mais vendidos da empresa. Os membros da Associação Internacional de Maquinistas e Trabalhadores Aeroespaciais votaram sobre uma proposta de contrato que inclui aumentos salariais de 25% em quatro anos. A greve não deverá causar cancelamentos de voos nem afetará diretamente os passageiros das companhias aéreas, mas será mais um golpe para a reputação e as finanças da Boeing, num ano marcado por problemas nas operações aéreas, de defesa e espaciais. Em destaque [](/) [](sapo24://share/?title=Trabalhadores+da+Boeing+em+Seattle+aprovam+greve&url=https%3A%2F%2F24.sapo.pt%2Fatualidade%2Fartigos%2Ftrabalhadores-da-boeing-em-seattle-aprovam-greve)

author: Kathleen de Villa
title: Duterte lawyer's proposal hit: 'Ignorant' of victims' plight | Global News
text:
Former President Duterte lead counsel Nicholas Kaufman —Screengrab from ICC video
MANILA, Philippines — Depriving drug war victims of their right to participate in the case against former President Rodrigo Duterte merely due to their lack of identification documents is a “grave injustice twice over,” a human rights lawyer recognized by the International Criminal Court (ICC) said on Wednesday.
CenterLaw president Joel Butuyan criticized the proposed restrictions by Duterte’s defense team on the type of IDs that should be accepted by the Pre-Trial Chamber (PTC) I to verify the identity of the victims, saying these “come from someone who is totally ignorant” of the kind of people who were killed in the bloody war on drugs.
Article continues after this advertisement Duterte is currently detained in The Hague, the Netherlands, as he awaits trial at the ICC for the charge of murder as a crime against humanity for being a coperpetrator in the “systematic and widespread” killings of thousands of drug suspects during his so-called war on drugs.
FEATURED STORIES GLOBALNATION ICC lawyer schools Duterte's lead counsel on drug war victims GLOBALNATION Duterte lawyer’s proposal hit: ‘Ignorant’ of victims’ plight GLOBALNATION Thailand revokes visa of US academic charged with royal insult Butuyan, also an Inquirer columnist, was reacting to the defense team’s April 7 filing where lead counsel Nicholas Kaufman urged the PTC to limit the valid IDs allowed to be presented to the court to only either the national ID or passport.
READ: Duterte lawyers seek limits to victims’ role in trial
This, Kaufman claimed, would “streamline proceedings” and adopt a “more stringent approach.”
“Limiting the range of identity documents enhances the reliability of the identity verification process and significantly reduces the risk of fraud,” Kaufman said in the filing of “observations” to the suggested procedures for victims of the ICC Registry, which provides judicial and administrative support to the court.
Article continues after this advertisement He said the use of varied and insufficiently verified identity documents “could lead to misidentification, double-counting and the inclusion of false victims,” and trigger “unnecessary and time-consuming litigation.”
‘Badges of wealth’ In a message to the Inquirer, Butuyan said: “The kind of IDs being demanded by Mr. Kaufman are documents that are badges of wealth and privilege in the Philippines.”
Article continues after this advertisement “They are unavailable to victims who wallow in poverty, and who constitute the overwhelming number of the people killed by his client,” he added.
“The victims’ families have already lost loved ones. For them to be refused recognition as victims of the murderous Mr. Duterte, because of their lack of government-issued IDs, is to make them suffer grave injustice twice over,” Butuyan said.
Human rights lawyer Kristina Conti, who has been assisting the victims in the ICC proceedings, had said the camp of Duterte was “antipoor” and “out of touch” to even suggest such a rule for the application of victims.
“Limiting the list of possible proofs of identity only discourages victims unnecessarily, almost heartlessly. We will, obviously, make a rejoinder supporting the initial proposals of the Victims Participation and Reparations Section [under the ICC Registry],” she said.
Victims’ representation Conti earlier said the defense’s insistence on the use of national IDs was unrealistic, considering that the issuance of the cards is plagued with consistent issues of delay, while their suggestion to produce passports is antipoor, “as only the socially mobile have the luxury to avail [themselves] of cross-country travel.”
On the issue of legal representation, Butuyan said it was “totally abhorrent” that the defense wanted to have a say on who would temporarily represent the victims in the ongoing ICC proceedings.
The defense insisted that the PTC recognize only the ICC’s Office of Public Counsel for Victims (OPCV) as the sole legal representative of the victims to avoid “slowing down the proceedings” by numerous submissions of their individual lawyers.
The OPCV, which provides legal assistance, research and court representation to victims, works independently from the ICC.
“Permitting submissions by individual lawyers for some, but not all, applicants while simultaneously appointing the OPCV for others will result in twice the number of submissions before this Chamber,” Kaufman claimed. “It will be unwieldy [and] unnecessarily encumber the defense … This will impact on Mr. Duterte’s right to a speedy judicial process.”
“No, Mr. Kaufman, the victims must have the say on who should speak for them, and not you who speaks for the mass murderer,” Butuyan stressed.
More evidence possible In a “TeleRadyo” interview, ICC spokesperson Fadi El Abdallah reiterated that the Office of the Prosecutor (OTP) could bring more charges and evidence against Duterte as the investigation into the killings in the context of the drug war is still ongoing.
“Whether the prosecutor wants to present additional evidence or request other charges, it will have to be presented to the judges and the judges will decide on that,” Abdallah explained.
Your subscription could not be saved. Please try again.
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->drug related crimes

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Choicese (CHC-SES) Drives Financial Digitization, Enhancing Financial Inclusion | User | times-online.com
text: In a major collaboration, Choicese (CHC-SES), the internationally renowned investment platform, has announced a strategic partnership with a leading brokerage firm to introduce stock trading services. By combining their expertise and resources, Choicese (CHC-SES) aims to provide investors with a convenient and secure stock trading platform, enabling them to participate in the stock market and embark on new investment journeys. This collaboration will further drive the development of the stock market, offering investors more options and increasing investment opportunities. With the booming stock market, an increasing number of investors are eager to participate in stock trading, seeking the opportunities and returns it offers. To meet this demand, Choicese (CHC-SES) has partnered with a well-known brokerage firm to launch stock trading services, providing investors with a convenient and secure trading platform. Through its collaboration with brokerage firms, Choicese (CHC-SES) has expanded its service range, enabling investors to trade stocks on the same platform. Investors can easily access the stock market through the Choicese (CHC-SES) app or online platform, executing buy and sell orders. This seamless integration offers investors a more convenient trading experience, saving time and effort. Additionally, the collaboration with brokerage firms brings more trading tools and features to Choicese (CHC-SES). Investors can access real-time market data, stock analysis, and research reports through the Choicese (CHC-SES) trading platform, aiding them in making informed investment decisions. The platform also provides trade execution and settlement services, ensuring the security and efficiency of the transaction process. This partnership positively impacts the development of the stock market. The global influence of Choicese (CHC-SES) combined with the brokerage firms' expertise will provide investors with more investment options and opportunities. Investors can choose stock trading strategies that suit their investment goals and risk tolerance, engaging in market fluctuations. The introduction of stock trading services will further promote the development of the stock market, increasing market liquidity and activity. Investors will be able to invest more flexibly, seizing more investment opportunities. Choicese (CHC-SES) will continue to collaborate with brokerage firms, offering investors more comprehensive and convenient investment services, collectively fostering the prosperity and sustainable development of the stock market. Disclaimer: The information provided in this press release is not a solicitation for investment, or intended as investment advice, financial advice, or trading advice. It is strongly recommended that you practice due diligence (including consultation with a professional financial advisor) before investing in or trading securities and cryptocurrency. author: Charles P. Pierce
title: Tennessee Republican Jason Zachary Introduced An 'Abortion Trafficking' Bill
text:
(Permanent Musical Accompaniment To This Post)
Being our semi-regular weekly survey of what's goin' down in the several states where, as we know, the real work of governmentin' gets done, and where, if he needs a third eye, he just grows it.
I must have missed it on the news or something but, apparently, it was Crazy Wingnut Bill Filing Week out in the several states. Let us begin in Tennessee , which has become a target-rich environment for such things. From the Tennessean:
Rep. Jason Zachary, R-Knoxville, filed House Bill 1895 . The legislation would establish a new Class C felony, which could carry three to 15 years in prison, for an adult that "recruits, harbors or transports" a pregnant minor for the purposes of receiving an out-of-state abortion or for getting abortion medication. Parents or legal guardians are exempt and would be allowed to take their pregnant child out of state. However, if another adult helps a pregnant minor obtain an abortion, the minor's consent doesn't matter. The legislation would also open up adults charged under the law to civil liability, allowing the biological mother or her parents to sue the adult who facilitated the abortion. The biological father could also sue, unless the pregnancy resulted from rape or incest as defined in Tennessee criminal code. There are far too many people in our land who are nostalgic for the days of the Fugitive Slave Act.
Up in Kentucky, the current wingnut hobby-horse has been taken out for a ride. From WKLY:
Rep. Jennifer Decker filed House Bill 9, which would prohibit colleges and universities from creating positions or implementing programs aimed at boosting diversity, equity and inclusion. She believes that universities are wasting money on salaries for DEI officers that should instead be going to minority students. "It is an exorbitant cost that does not seem to result in a metric that is an indication that our campuses are more diverse," Decker said. I don't want to intimate that Rep. Decker's concern for increasing the funding for "minority students" at Kentucky's universities is based in obvious bad faith, but Rep. Decker's concern for increasing the funding for "minority students" is based in obvious bad faith. From the Lexington Herald-Leader .
Decker’s bill includes provisions intended to limit its reach into the classroom and more pointedly target university administration. It states that nothing in the bill shall be construed to limit academic freedom, academic course material, research or compliance with federal and state laws or court orders...It codifies a ban on “manipulating or influencing” the composition of a student body on the basis of race, religion, sex, color or national origin. That comports with the U.S. Supreme Court’s ruling last year that held that race-based affirmative action admissions programs are unconstitutional. Decker’s proposed legislation also targets “discriminatory concepts.” Those are defined as “presenting as truth, rather than as a subject for inquiry, that an existing structure system or relation of power, privilege or subordination persists on the basis of oppression, colonialism, socioeconomic status, religion, race, sex, color, or national origin.” That last part is very, very special. Power, privilege, or subordination is now declared not to persist. Poof! Thank you, Rep. Decker, you magical wingnut, you.
Meanwhile, over in Missouri, a cannibal feast has broken out within the Republican legislative majority, which has been spinning off into the wingnutosphere for some time now. From NPR in St. Louis:
“The beginning of the 2024 legislative session in the Senate has been nothing short of an embarrassment,” Senate President Pro Tem Caleb Rowden, R-Columbia, said Tuesday, flanked by 14 fellow Republican senators. “A chamber designed to be occupied with civil, principled statesmen and women has been overtaken by a small group of swamp creatures, who all too often remind me more of my children than my colleagues.” Go, Senator Caleb, go! Although, it seems like you just called your kids "swamp creatures."
At least twice the session, inquiries and actions from the Freedom Caucus have caused the Senate to adjourn abruptly. Last Thursday, the Freedom Caucus filibustered for over eight hours to hold up the approval of 25 appointments by Gov. Mike Parson. Those appointments included Robert Knodell and Paula Nickelson as the permanent directors of the departments of Social Services and Health and Senior Services, respectively. Members of the caucus held up the appointments because they believed the Senate was not moving forward fast enough on asking voters to make it harder to amend Missouri’s constitution. The caucus threatened to continue to hold up the appointments until such a plan passes the Senate. Speaking on the Senate floor Tuesday to Eigel, Rowden said the end of last week “became a crescendo that I could no longer ignore.” “I said this to you last week and I'll say it again, what you did last week was aimed at undercutting the floor leader [Sen. Cindy O’Laughlin, R-Shelbina],” Rowden said. Senator Caleb also took some familiar Beacon Hill-style retribution on the committee chairmen he'd canned.
In addition to being stripped of their chairmanships, the senators were assigned new parking spots that are farther away from the Capitol. Go full Billy Bulger, Senator Caleb. Put their desks in a hallway.
We now will dedicate the rest of our semi-regular weekly survey to the doings in the great state of Oklahoma. The legislature there seems to have discovered some unusual mushrooms growing out in back of the Capitol. First, there is the anti-furries bill. From the Oklahoman:
One Oklahoma lawmaker, Rep. Justin Humphrey, R-Lane, decided to file a bill targeting "furries," or people in a subculture interested in anthropomorphic animal characters, in Oklahoma schools. Humphrey's bill, House Bill 3084 , would ban "students who purport to be an imaginary animal or animal species, or who engage in anthropomorphic behavior commonly referred to as furries at school" from participating in class and school activities. The bill would require parents or guardians to pick the student up from school. But, if parents are unable to pick the student up, the bill says "animal control services shall be contacted to remove the student." How? Nets? Trank guns. I see an opening for a new Discovery Channel show— The Furry Hunters . Genius.
Elsewhere in the Chamber Of Crackpots, we find a bill that, even if it passes, surely will be overturned for approximately 535 reasons . From Fox25 in Oklahoma City:
One bill, filed on Tuesday by Rep. Justin Humphrey (R-Lane), could prove controversial for the legislature. House Bill 3133 would label any Hispanic person who is part of a gang a terrorist. The bill states a Hispanic person who has been convicted of gang-related offenses shall be "deemed to have committed an act of terrorism." If that happens, the person could have their real estate, money, vehicles and personal property seized by the state. The levels of discrimination in this bill are almost incalculable. And this is the state in which was carried out the single most deadly act of actual terrorism in the country's history, which, by the by, was not carried out by anyone named Juan or Manuel. But the real star in the early going is a rookie legislator named Dusty Deevers, a preacher who won a special election who has really hit the ground running, although in what direction remains uncertain. From The Sentinel :
Oklahoma Republican State Senator Dusty Deevers proposed a number of bills this week meant to abolish abortion, repeal no-fault divorce, and ban pornography, as well as introduce a crackdown on false testimony with respect to crimes, reform election laws, eliminate state income taxes, provide a grocery tax rebate, and create electronic access for transactional gold. Reverend Dusty has an explanation for everything he does, although his rationale for the end of no-fault divorce seems a bit too Game of Thrones for this millennium.
“When a man leaves his father and mother, and he and his wife become one flesh, that is the foundation of a strong nation and civilization,” he wrote in a recent opinion piece about the necessity of reforming divorce laws. “Governing for the common good is the charge of all sitting in public office. It is abundantly clear that the current regime of no-fault divorce has torn down the castles that uphold the strength of the realm. We must do away with this policy for the justice of the oppressed, the strength of the nation, and the future of humanity.” "Castles"? "Strength of the realm"? "The realm"? Forsooth, what manner of witchcraft is this?
“Our team took a no-compromise stance against the greatest evils of our day and for the freedom and liberty of the people,” he said in a statement after his election. “We defeated some big-money, establishment interests on a shoestring budget. It truly is of God that we won.” God had better writers once upon a time.
And we conclude, as promised and as is our custom, in exactly the same place, the great state of Oklahoma, whence Blog Official chuckwalla whisperer Friedman of the Plains brings us a tale of true meritocracy in government hiring. From the Oklahoman:
Raichik is a former Brooklyn real estate agent who grew up in Los Angeles. The California woman behind the “Libs of TikTok” social media account will serve on the Oklahoma Library Media Advisory Committee. She created the @LibsofTikTok handle on Twitter, now X, in April 2021. "Libs of TikTok" has over 2.8 million followers and reposts TikTok videos of users sharing liberal views while adding derisive conservative commentary. Records show Raichik lived in Florida at least until the end of 2023 before moving from Brooklyn and Los Angeles. There's no indication Raichik has ever lived in Oklahoma, and there isn't any property in Oklahoma County under her name. When asked about where Raichik lives, Dan Isett, an Oklahoma Department of Education spokesperson, emailed The Oklahoman this statement: "Superintendent Walters appointed Raichik to this advisory board because no one has done more to bring attention to what the left does in our schools. Her insight is invaluable, and she will work hard to keep porn and woke indoctrination out of the classroom." I guess Steve Bannon's line was busy.
This is your democracy, America. Cherish it.
Related Story Who Is Charles Koch When He's At Home? Charles P. Pierce Charles P Pierce is the author of four books, most recently Idiot America , and has been a working journalist since 1976. He lives near Boston and has three children.
Watch Next
